biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2

Class NativeLessOptionsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.NativeLessOptionsBuilder

  • public class NativeLessOptionsBuilder
extends Object

    Responsible for creating options that control the NativeLessCompiler compilation process.

    Base options:

    • compression - whether a CSS code should be compressed (default: false)
    • IE compatibility - whether a CSS code should be compatible with Internet Explorer browser (default: true)
    • included paths - available include paths (default: empty collection)
    • input file - an input (source) file
    • JavaScript - whether a compiler should allow usage of JavaScript language (default: true)
    • line numbers - whether a compiler should generate inline source-mapping (default: LineNumbersValue.OFF)
    • output file - an output (destination) file
    • relative URLs - whether a compiler should rewrite relative URLs (default: false)
    • root path - a path which will be added to every generated import and URL in CSS code (default: null)
    • silent - whether a compiler shouldn't log compilation warnings (default: false)
    • strict imports - whether a compiler should disallow an @import operation inside of either @media blocks or other selector blocks (default: false)
    • strict math - whether a compiler should try and process all maths in Less code (default: false)
    • strict units - whether a compiler should guess units in Less code when it does maths (default: false)

    Source Map options:

    • You can set where Source Map will be saved by using one of the options (mutually exclusive):
      • default - generate a Source Map file with a default name equal to output file name with map extension (default: false)
      • file - generate a Source Map file (default: null).
      • inline - generate a Source Map and put it to CSS code (default: false)
    • base path - a path that will be removed from each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also from the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null)
    • Less inline - whether a compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map (default: false)
    • root path - a path that will be prepended to each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also to the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null)
    • URL - a path which will overwrite the URL in the CSS that points at the Source Map file (default: null)

    Non-standard options:

    • encoding - an encoding used to read source files and save generated code (default: null - means platform default encoding)

    Example code: 

     Collection<String> options = null;
 
 // create options with an input file
 options = new NativeLessOptionsBuilder().inputFile(new File("file.less")).build();
 
 // create options with an input file and compression enabled
 options = new NativeLessOptionsBuilder().inputFile(new File("file.less")).compress(true).build();
 
 // use LessOptions object to create options 
 LessOptions lessOptions = new LessOptions();
 ... // modify options
 options = new NativeLessOptionsBuilder().options(lessOptions).build();
    Since:
    2.0.0
    See Also:
    LessOptions

      • options

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder options(LessOptions options)
        Sets compiler options. This method overwrites values set by:
        • compress(boolean)
        • encoding(String)
        • ieCompatibility(boolean)
        • includePaths(List)
        • javaScript(boolean)
        • lineNumbers(LineNumbersValue)
        • relativeUrls(boolean)
        • rootPath(String)
        • silent(boolean)
        • sourceMapBasePath(String)
        • sourceMapLessInline(boolean)
        • sourceMapRootPath(String)
        • sourceMapUrl(String)
        • strictImports(boolean)
        • strictMath(boolean)
        • strictUnits(boolean)
        Parameters:
        options - the options object.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the options object is null.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • includePaths

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder includePaths(List<String> includePaths)
        Sets available include paths (default: empty collection). If the file in an @import rule does not exist at that exact location, a compiler will look for it at the location(s) passed to this option. You might use this for instance to specify a path to a library which you want to be referenced simply and relatively in the less files.
        Parameters:
        includePaths - the available include paths.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • lineNumbers

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder lineNumbers(LineNumbersValue lineNumbers)
        Sets whether a compiler should generate inline source-mapping (default: LineNumbersValue.OFF). This was the only option before browsers started supporting Source Maps.
        Parameters:
        lineNumbers - the line numbers value (null is treated as LineNumbersValue.OFF).
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:

      • sourceMapDefault

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder sourceMapDefault(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether a compiler should generate a Source Map file with a default name equal to output file name with map extension (default: false). It does not matter whether you call this method before or after the outputFile(File) method.

        This method clears bulider's data set by the sourceMapFile(File) and the sourceMapInline(boolean) methods.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true whether the compiler should generate the Source Map file, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        outputFile(File), sourceMapFile(File), sourceMapInline(boolean)

      • sourceMapInline

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder sourceMapInline(boolean inline)
        Sets whether a compiler should generate a Source Map and put it to CSS code (default: false). This is not recommended for production, but for development it allows the compiler to produce a single output file which in browsers that support it, use the compiled CSS but show you the non-compiled Less source.

        This method clears bulider's data set by the sourceMapDefault(boolean) and the sourceMapFile(File) methods.

        Parameters:
        inline - true whether the compiler should generate a Source Map, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapDefault(boolean), sourceMapFile(File), sourceMapLessInline(boolean)

        protected String[] getSourceMapInlineOptions()

        Returns:
        the command line options (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapInline(boolean)

      • sourceMapLessInline

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder sourceMapLessInline(boolean inline)
        Sets whether a compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map (default: false). This means that you only need your map file to get to your original source.

        This can be used in conjunction with the map inline option so that you do not need to have any additional external files at all.

        Parameters:
        inline - true whether the compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapInline(boolean)

      • getSourceMapLessInlineOption

        protected String getSourceMapLessInlineOption()
        Returns a command line options which enables/disables generating a Source Map which will be put to CSS code.
        Returns:
        the command line options (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapLessInline(boolean)

      • sourceMapRootPath

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder sourceMapRootPath(String rootPath)
        Sets a path that will be prepended to each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also to the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null).

        Use it if for instance you have a CSS file generated in the root on your web server but have your source less/css/map files in a different folder.

        Example: if you have a follow file structure: 

         output.css
 dev-files/output.css.map
 dev-files/output.less

        then you should set the Source Map root path to dev-files/.

        This option is the opposite of the Source Map base path option.

        Parameters:
        rootPath - the path which will be added.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapBasePath(String), sourceMapUrl(String)

      • getSourceMapRootPathOption

        protected String getSourceMapRootPathOption()
        Returns a command line option representation of the Source Map root path.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapRootPath(String)

      • sourceMapBasePath

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder sourceMapBasePath(String basePath)
        Sets a path that will be removed from each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also from the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null).

        It specifies a path which should be removed from the output paths. For instance if you are compiling a file in the less-files directory but the source files will be available on your web server in the root or current directory, you can specify this to remove the additional less-files part of the path.

        This option is the opposite of the Source Map root path option.

        Parameters:
        basePath - the path which will be removed.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapRootPath(String), sourceMapUrl(String)

      • getSourceMapBasePathOption

        protected String getSourceMapBasePathOption()
        Returns a command line option representation of the Source Map base path.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapBasePath(String)

      • sourceMapUrl

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder sourceMapUrl(String url)
        Sets a path which will overwrite the URL in the CSS that points at the Source Map file (default: null). This is for cases when the root path and the base path options are not producing exactly what you need.
        Parameters:
        url - the Source Map URL.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapBasePath(String), sourceMapRootPath(String)

        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        sourceMapUrl(String)

      • rootPath

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder rootPath(String rootPath)
        Sets a path which will be added to every generated import and URL in CSS code (default: null). This does not affect less import statements that are processed, just ones that are left in the output CSS.

        For instance, if all the images the CSS use are in a folder called resources, you can use this option to add this on to the URL's and then have the name of that folder configurable.

        Parameters:
        rootPath - the path which will be added.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getRootPathOption

        protected String getRootPathOption()
        Returns a command line option representation of the root path.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        rootPath(String)

      • relativeUrls

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder relativeUrls(boolean relativeUrls)
        Sets whether a compiler should rewrite relative URLs (default: false). By default URLs are kept as-is, so if you import a file in a sub-directory that references an image, exactly the same URL will be output in the CSS code. This option allows you to re-write URLs in imported files so that the URL is always relative to the base imported file. Example: 
         # main.less
 @import "files/backgrounds.less";
 
 # files/backgrounds.less
 .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        this will output the following normally 

         .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        but with this option on it will instead output 

         .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('files/images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        You may also want to consider using the data-uri function instead of this option, which will embed images into the CSS.

        Parameters:
        relativeUrls - true whether the compiler should rewrite relative URLs, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getRelativeUrlsOption

        protected String getRelativeUrlsOption()
        Returns a command line option which enables/disables rewriting relative URLs.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        relativeUrls(boolean)

      • strictMath

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder strictMath(boolean strictMath)
        Sets whether a compiler should try and process all maths in Less code (default: false). Without this option on the compiler will try and process all maths in your Less e.g.: 
         .class {
     height: calc(100% - 10px);
 }

        will be processed currently.

        With strict math on, only maths that is inside unnecessary parenthesis will be processed. Example: 

         .class {
     width: calc(100% - ((10px  - 5px)));
     height: (100px / 4px);
     font-size: 1 / 4;
 }

        will be compiled to 

         .class {
     width: calc(100% - 5px);
     height: 25px;
     font-size: 1 / 4;
 }
        Parameters:
        strictMath - true whether the compiler should try and process all maths in the Less code, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        strictUnits(boolean)

      • getStrictMathOption

        protected String getStrictMathOption()
        Returns a command line option which enables/disables strict math.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        strictMath(boolean)

      • strictUnits

        public NativeLessOptionsBuilder strictUnits(boolean strictUnits)
        Sets whether a compiler should guess units in Less code when it does maths (default: false). Without this option, the compiler attempts to guess at the output unit when it does maths. For instance: 
         .class {
     property: 1px * 2px;
 }

        In this case, things are clearly not right - a length multiplied by a length gives an area, but CSS does not support specifying areas. So we assume that the user meant for one of the values to be a value, not a unit of length and Less outputs 2px. With strict units on, Less assumes this is a bug in the calculation and throw an error.

        Parameters:
        strictUnits - true whether the compiler should guess units in the Less code when it does maths, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        strictMath(boolean)

      • getStrictUnitsOption

        protected String getStrictUnitsOption()
        Returns a command line option which enables/disables strict units.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        strictUnits(boolean)

      • build

        public Collection<String> build()
        Builds a collection with configuration options for the NativeLessCompiler compilation process.
        Returns:
        the collection with configuration options.
        Throws:

        Since:
